body_html: I installed tensorflow from Source had the same problem. I noticed that while executing the command "sudo pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.5.0-py2-none-any.whl", I was executing it by copying and pasting it directly which was wrong because the term "tensorflow-1.5.0-py2-none-any.whl" need to be replaced with the right name of the .whl file. First time running it gave some error but when I ran it again, it worked like a charm. You can find it in location /tmp/tensorflow_pkg. Just putting it here hoping it would save someone else's load of time.

body: I installed tensorflow from Source had the same problem. I noticed that while executing the command "sudo pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.5.0-py2-none-any.whl", I was executing it by copying and pasting it directly which was wrong because the term "tensorflow-1.5.0-py2-none-any.whl" need to be replaced with the right name of the .whl file. First time running it gave some error but when I ran it again, it worked like a charm. You can find it in location /tmp/tensorflow_pkg. Just putting it here hoping it would save someone else's load of time.
